programme.title: NBA Countdown
programme.desc: "NBA Countdown" serves as the primer for game telecasts on the ESPN family of networks. It's highlighted by a lively roundtable discussion and debate of the top storylines around the league. Seats at the table are reserved for folks in ESPN's stable of NBA hosts and analysts, with the latter group imparting wisdom based on their many years of playing experience.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Cavaliers battle with the Bucks. Cleveland's Donovan Mitchell and Jarrett Allen went toe-to-toe with Milwaukee's Giannis Antetokounmpo and Damian Lillard on Dec. 29, 2023, but the Bucks duo outscored the Cavs' twosome 65-64 in a 119-111 victory.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 12 Wildcats (12-4, 3-2 Pac-12) seek a sixth straight win over the Trojans (8-9, 2-4). Arizona comes off a stunning 73-70 loss at Washington State, which won at USC 72-64 on Jan. 10. Caleb Love (ARIZ) totaled 51 points over his last two games.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: Luka Doncic and the Mavericks aim to claim a season-series sweep of the Lakers. Dallas won the previous two 2023-24 meetings with Los Angeles by a combined five points. Doncic averaged 31.5 points, 12.5 assists and nine rebounds in those victories.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee brings his humor and candor to the microphone to highlight the day's top stories.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: In-depth, comprehensive daily coverage of all aspects of the NBA from expert analysts.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Nuggets tip off with the Eastern Conference-leading Celtics. Denver rang in a new era versus Boston with a 123-111 triumph on New Year's Day in 2023, snapping a six-game series slide. Denver star Nikola Jokic provided a signature triple-double.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Warriors return to the Chase Center as they host the Mavericks. Golden State was 2-5 during its last run here, dropping its home mark to 11-11. One loss came at the hands of Dallas on Dec. 30, 2023, as Luka Doncic's 39 points paced a 132-122 win.

programme.title: College GameDay
programme.desc: "College GameDay" gets fans ready for all the day's action in men's college basketball with exclusive interviews, analysis, behind-the-scenes features and predictions. The primary host is Rece Davis, joined by analysts Jay Bilas, Seth Greenberg and LaPhonso Ellis. The show typically originates from the site of one of the day's biggest games.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: From Moody Center in Austin, Texas.

programme.title: Postseason NFL Countdown
programme.desc: A review of the NFL playoffs and a look ahead to the Super Bowl.

programme.title: NFL Football
programme.desc: The divisional round begins with Lamar Jackson and the Ravens hosting C.J. Stroud and the Texans in the AFC. Rookie sensation Stroud led Houston to an overpowering wild-card win against Cleveland. Jackson is expected to win his second MVP.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 8 Wildcats lick their wounds against the Bulldogs in a return to Rupp Arena. Kentucky's six-game run ended as it fell to Texas A&M in overtime Jan. 13. Kentucky has won 17 of the past 18 meetings after beating Mississippi State in 2022-23.

programme.desc: From Melbourne Park in Melbourne, Victoria, Australia.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Beavers make a trip to play the Utes. In 2022-23, Utah swept the two-game series with the Beavers for the first time since joining the Pac-12 in 2011. Branden Carlson, the Utes' leading scorer in 2023-24, totaled 39 points in those victories.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Rams (10-7, 2-2 A-10) aim to take advantage of the Billikens (8-9, 1-3) in this clash. Saint Louis could not prevent Dayton from extending its win streak to 11 games on Jan. 16, falling 70-65. VCU is 14-5 against Saint Louis dating back to 2010.

programme.title: 2024 Australian Open Tennis
programme.desc: From Melbourne Park in Melbourne, Victoria, Australia.

programme.title: NFL Matchup
programme.desc: An NFL Films production, "NFL Matchup" is definitely a show for football junkies. Unlike traditional football preview programs, this one gives fans an in-depth look at some of Sunday's games by breaking down the strategy and tactics -- the Xs and Os -- through the exclusive use of team-supplied footage. That type of film study is a forte of former NFL player and executive Louis Riddick and NFL Films producer Greg Cosell, whose work is featured here alongside host Sal Paolantonio.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 1 Huskies (15-2, 5-1) host the No. 18 Bluejays (13-4, 4-2) for a Top 25 Big East showdown. Creighton has won six of seven meetings. UConn comes off an 80-67 victory over Georgetown behind sophomore Alex Karaban's career high-tying 26 points.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Friars visit the Blue Demons in a battle of Big East teams riding four-game slides. Providence won the last four meetings. Friars guard Devin Carter averages 17.8 points and 8.4 rebounds per contest after totaling 74 and 30 over his last three.

programme.desc: Highlights, analysis and preview of the day's college basketball action.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Tom Izzo tries to inch closer to a milestone as his Spartans host the Golden Gophers for a Big Ten tussle. Izzo sits 27th on the all-time Div-I list with 697 coaching victories. Michigan State won the last two meetings, and seven of the past eight.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 14 Fighting Illini (12-4, 3-2 Big Ten) vie for a seventh straight victory over the Wolverines (7-10, 2-4). Illinois dropped two of its last three games following a stunning 76-67 setback against Maryland despite 26 points from Marcus Domask.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Ducks begin their final trip to the Rockies as a member of the Pac-12 by playing the Buffaloes. Oregon joins the Big Ten next season while Colorado moves to the Big 12. The Ducks ride a six-game win streak, and are 3-0 in true road contests.

programme.title: TMZ Sports
programme.desc: Gossip and exclusive stories about athletes' personal lives.

programme.title: The Carton Show
programme.desc: Craig Carton, one of New York's best-known voices, analyzes and debates the biggest headlines in sports each morning.

programme.title: Undisputed
programme.desc: A daily sports talk show hosted by Skip Bayless, where each day Skip is joined by a cast of NFL legends for passionate conversations about the biggest sports topics of the day.

programme.title: The Herd with Colin Cowherd
programme.desc: Colin Cowherd and co-host Jason McIntyre break down the biggest stories and interview the biggest guests in sports.

programme.title: First Things First
programme.desc: Nick Wright, Chris Broussard and Kevin Wildes explore and energetically advance the biggest stories in sports to start the day.

programme.title: Speak
programme.desc: Opinions and predictions for happenings in the NFL.

programme.title: NFL Films Presents
programme.desc: A unique perspective on the heroes and personalities of the NFL.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: From Cintas Center in Cincinnati.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 11 Badgers host the Hoosiers. Wisconsin has won eight straight at home. During the 2022-23 matchup between the longtime Big Ten rivals, Indiana held Wisconsin to its lowest point total in the series since 1992 with a smothering 63-45 triumph.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Rebels try for a third straight win at Moby Arena when they link up with the Rams in Fort Collins, Colo. UNLV has won three of the past four versus Colorado State, with the lone setback coming by just one point in overtime Jan. 14, 2023.

programme.title: PokerStars Caribbean Adventure
programme.desc: Poker action from 2018.

programme.title: TMZ Sports
programme.desc: Gossip and exclusive stories about athletes' personal lives.

programme.title: TMZ Sports Weekend
programme.desc: Our news team constantly breaks exclusive stories featuring the biggest stars in sports.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Rebels try for a third straight win at Moby Arena when they link up with the Rams in Fort Collins, Colo. UNLV has won three of the past four versus Colorado State, with the lone setback coming by just one point in overtime Jan. 14, 2023.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 11 Badgers host the Hoosiers. Wisconsin has won eight straight at home. During the 2022-23 matchup between the longtime Big Ten rivals, Indiana held Wisconsin to its lowest point total in the series since 1992 with a smothering 63-45 triumph.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Hoyas (8-9, 1-5 Big East) travel to take on the Musketeers (9-8, 3-3). Xavier has won back-to-back games, and looks ahead to showdowns with Creighton and UConn next week. Georgetown is 4-15 against Xavier since the Musketeers joined the Big East.

programme.title: Bassmaster: the Cast
programme.desc: Jimmy Houston & Roland Martin were two of the early stars on the B.A.S.S tournament series, each with special qualities the drove them to the top of fishing fame.

programme.title: Bassmaster Review
programme.desc: The final two events of the 2023 Bassmaster Elite Series takes fishermen to New York for Lake Champlain and the St. Lawrence River, where history is made and records broken.

programme.title: Bassmaster Review
programme.desc: The path to qualify for the top-level Elite Series happens at the nine-event Bassmaster Opens. Watch anglers across the world compete to make the next step in the sport of bass fishing.

programme.desc: Coverage of motorcycle racing action from around the world.

programme.title: 147th Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show
programme.desc: The 147th Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show is America's second-longest continuously held sporting event. From the USTA Billie Jean King National Tennis Center in Flushing Meadows -- Corona Park in Queens, New York City.

programme.title: 147th Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show
programme.desc: Day 2 of the 147th Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show; the winning dogs across the seven AKC-recognized groups compete for the ultimate prize at the USTA Billie Jean King National Tennis Center.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 1 Huskies (15-2, 5-1) host the No. 18 Bluejays (13-4, 4-2) for a Top 25 Big East showdown. Creighton has won six of seven meetings. UConn comes off an 80-67 victory over Georgetown behind sophomore Alex Karaban's career high-tying 26 points.

programme.title: Back to School With Gus Johnson
programme.desc: Broadcaster Gus Johnson returns to school for a year-long prestigious fellowship program at Harvard University.

programme.title: All Madden
programme.desc: A tribute to John Madden's groundbreaking career - centered largely on the time after his Hall of Fame coaching career ended.

programme.title: The Great Brady Heist
programme.desc: Chronicling the disappearance of Tom Brady's jersey following the New England Patriots' improbable Super Bowl LI comeback win over the Atlanta Falcons.

programme.title: Tua
programme.desc: Tua Tagovailoa, a generational football talent, embarks on a journey that began from a childhood family prophecy. Tua attempts to overcome a career-threatening injury and rise as one of the most uniquely skilled players in the history of the game.

programme.title: The Masters Agility Championship at Westminster
programme.desc: The top agility dogs in the world compete for the title at Westminster.

programme.title: NBA TV Marquee Matchup
programme.desc: Joel Embiid had 41 points - including 10 straight points late in the fourth quarter - and 10 assists to lead the Philadelphia 76ers past Nikola Jokic and the Denver Nuggets 126-121 in a battle of the last two NBA MVPs. From Jan. 16, 2024.

programme.title: Unfinished Business: Advancing Dr. Kings' Dream
programme.desc: Killer Mike, Dr. Raphael Warnock, Julius Erving, and Grant Hill explore and reflect upon the enduring impact of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.'s life and legacy.

programme.title: Dunk Contest
programme.desc: First-ever slam dunk contest was held in 1976, which was won by Julius Erving over David Thompson. In 1984, the contest was reintroduced with Larry Nance beating Julius Erving.

programme.title: Dunk Contest
programme.desc: Spud Webb and Dominique Wilkins compete in the finals of the 1986 Slam Dunk contest from Dallas.

programme.title: Dunk Contest
programme.desc: Michael Jordan and Jerome Kersey compete in the finals of the 1987 Slam Dunk contest from Seattle.

programme.title: Dunk Contest
programme.desc: Kenny Walker and Clyde Drexler compete in the finals of the 1989 Slam Dunk contest from Houston.

programme.title: Dominique Wilkins
programme.desc: Hawks' forward Dominique Wilkins and Kings' guard Kenny Smith compete in the Finals of the 1990 NBA Slam Dunk Contest from Miami.

programme.title: Dunk Contest
programme.desc: Dee Brown and Shawn Kemp compete in the finals of the 1991 Slam Dunk contest from Charlotte.

programme.title: Dunk Contest
programme.desc: Cedric Ceballos and Larry Johnson compete in the finals of the 1992 Slam Dunk contest from Orlando.

programme.title: Dunk Contest
programme.desc: Harlod Miner, Clarence Weatherspoon and Cedric Ceballos compete in the finals of the 1993 Slam Dunk contest from Salt Lake City.

programme.title: Dunk Contest
programme.desc: Harold Miner, Isiah Rider, Jamie Watson, Antonio Harvey, Tim Perry and Tony Dumas compete in the 1995 contest. From Phoenix.

programme.title: Dunk Contest
programme.desc: Brent Barry, Michael Finley, Greg Minor, Jerry Stackhouse, Doug Christie, and Darrell Armstrong compete in 1996 contest. From San Antonio.

programme.title: Dunk Contest
programme.desc: Desmond Mason, Deshawn Stevenson, Baron Davis, Jonathan Bender, Stromile Swift and Corey Maggette compete in the 2001 contest. From Washington, D.C.

programme.title: Dunk Contest
programme.desc: Jason Richardson, Desmond Mason, Gerald Wallace and Steve Francis compete in the 2002 contest. From Philadelphia.

programme.title: Dunk Contest
programme.desc: Fred Jones, Jason Richardson, Chris Andersen and Ricky Davis compete in the 2004 contest. From Los Angeles.

programme.title: Dunk Contest
programme.desc: Josh Smith, Amar'e Stoudemire, J.R. Smith and Chris Andersen compete in the 2005 contest. From Denver.

programme.title: Dunk Contest
programme.desc: Nate Robinson, Andre Iguodala, Josh Smith and Hakim Warrick compete in the 2006 contest. From Houston.

programme.title: Inside the NBA
programme.desc: This Emmy Award-winning studio show, which airs following each NBA telecast on TNT, is hosted by Ernie Johnson, with analysis from Hall of Famer Charles Barkley and NBA champions Kenny Smith and Shaquille O'Neal. It's a mix of highlights, interviews and hijinks, notably the verbal sparring sessions between the outspoken Barkley and his straight man, Smith. The show also welcomes various guest analysts throughout the season.
